report_title: Flower & Nursery Stock Wholesaling in the US
executive_summary: Flower and nursery stock wholesalers encountered some complications during the COVID-19 pandemic because of operational restrictions, supply chain disruptions and fluctuating end-market performance. However, a surge in funeral services because of COVID-related deaths allowed the industry to remain performant despite prolonged slowdowns in other events like weddings and parties. Meanwhile, traditional sales channels – like suppliers and importers that sell flowers and nursery stock in bulk to wholesalers – have endured shrinking sales themselves, and accounted for less than half of total industry transactions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Stifled Demand From Some Markets, While Other Markets Flourished
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the COVID-19 pandemic, nonessential businesses were forced to temporarily close to slow the spread of the virus. This had multiple effects on the Flower and Nursery Stock Wholesaling industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Price-Based Competition Has Increased, Leading to Lower Profit
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Wholesalers provide floral products to retail buyers that cannot purchase directly from suppliers because their purchase quantities are too low to meet minimum order requirements.
While traditional wholesaling channels are encountering complications, new revenue streams and business models are emerging.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Flower and Nursery Stock Wholesaling Industry Will See Growth in the Coming Years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumer spending will continue to be strong amid higher disposable income levels and low unemployment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry Still Faces Considerable Long-Term Challenges
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite the industry growing more slowly than in the previous five-year period, revenue volatility will significantly calm down.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Many Wholesalers Will Restructure Their Operations To Eliminate Intermediaries And Mitigate Costs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increasingly, wholesalers are expanding their geographical locations to their products' origins to ensure supply.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Wholesalers Will Direct Their Efforts Toward Small to Medium-Sized Retailers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Some wholesalers use local supplies to add a point of differentiation and build emotional connections with buyers.
Flower and nursery stock wholesalers will continue to change their business models to avoid becoming irrelevant in the supply chain.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry sell flowers, nursery stock and florists' supplies to retail outlets.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Wholesaling companies in this industry compete based on price to remain attractive while maintaining a bottom line.
Substitute products are a major component of competition in this industry.
The need for wholesalers dwindles as local growers increasingly opt to sell their products directly to retailers.
Wholesalers source their products directly from farms in South America.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Specialized retailers like florists and nursery/garden centers receive products from wholesalers.
Nonspecialized retailers like home improvement stores and grocery stores are major buyers.

products_and_services.product_description: The industry sells two main types of products: floral stock and nursery stock.
Potted flowering plants are a type of floral stock product sold by the industry.

tier_1_suppliers: Plant & Flower Growing in the US
Wood Product Manufacturing in the US
Plastic Products Miscellaneous Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Florists are a dominant market and key link to consumers.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast benefits from ports like Miami that handle large flower imports.
The West region, with California as a major import hub, has expanded its share of locations due to free trade.

regulations_points.regulation_title: U.S. Patent and Trademark Office regulations
regulations_points.regulation_description: Laws enforced by the US Patent and Trademark Office relate to the protection of intellectual property rights.

basis_points.basis_description: Wholesaling companies in this industry compete based on price to remain attractive.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The four largest companies in this industry account for less than 5.0% of industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs represent the largest expense for the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages drop due to technological innovations
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Adoption of new technology cuts labor costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The industry relies on warehouse and transportation outsourcing
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry relies on warehouse and transportation outsourcing.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Flowers and nursery stock are discretionary products

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Climate-controlled warehouses are vital to preserving plant freshness.

FAQs.question: How have your sales been affected by the growth of online shopping?
FAQs.answer: Flower wholesalers have been negatively affected by growth in online shopping.
